answers.answer: Ukrainian minors under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for free accommodation in school dormitories, a daily food allowance, and financial support for school supplies, bedding, clothing, and footwear. The authorities also ensure the right to education for Ukrainian preschoolers, pupils, and students, and offer psycho-pedagogical assistance and free courses and activities for refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the sections under 'My rights' and 'Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian children can continue their education by enrolling in Romanian schools, kindergartens, or extracurricular activities through the County Schools Inspectorates. Additionally, options include Ukrainian online or part-time kindergartens, Ukrainian schools and classes in various cities, remote learning platforms, and free education in private schools in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the sections under 'How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities' and 'Ukrainian schools and kindergartens in Romania'.

answers.answer: To enroll a child in school, first contact the County Schools Inspectorates. Next, fill out the application for enrollment, ensuring to check the option for psycho-pedagogical assistance if desired, and submit it either physically or online via e-mail. The application will be analyzed within one day, and a Commission will contact you to jointly decide on the child's assignment to a group or class.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in school'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can have their previous studies recognized by contacting the National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence (CNRED). They need to submit a file containing documents like diplomas, school records, and identification, either online, physically, or by mail. CNRED evaluates the complete file within a maximum of 30 working days and issues a certificate of recognition.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the sections under 'Equivalence of studies' and 'I have completed my studies'.

answers.answer: The content provides information regarding the structure of the Romanian school year, including the structure for the 2024-2025 school year and a list of days off in Romanian educational institutions.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Calendar of holidays in schools and kindergartens in Romania'.
